column2: Please purchase and equip a #02sword,\narmor and shield#00, then return to\nthis house.
column3: ...麻烦你。\n#02剑#00、#02铠甲#00和#02盾牌#00都备齐之后，\n再来这里一趟好吗。
剑士大人...\n谢谢你的莅临。

column2: Tell me, are you\nfamiliar with the\nBooks of Ys?
column3: 容我开门见山的问你，\n剑士大人，请问你知道\n『伊苏之书』吗？
知道
不知道

column2: I'm glad I asked, then. I recently\nfound out that one of the Books of\nYs is in the mountaintop shrine.
column3: ...太好了，那么这说来就快了。\n不瞒你说，我得到了一个启示，有一本『伊苏之书』\n正沉眠在山上的神殿之中。
所以剑士大人...我想...\n麻烦你去寻找『伊苏之书』\n不知你愿不愿意？
愿意
不愿意

column2: You will? Ah, swordsman, you are\ntruly the man I've been seeking!\nThank you so very, very much!
column3: 你真的愿意吗！？\n剑士大人...太感谢你了...

column2: Please, take this with you. It will\nshow you the way within the shrine.
column3: 请你收下这个东西。\n它应该可以在神殿成为你的路标。

column2: I see... I am disappointed. I had\nbelieved you to be the one I sought.
column3: 是这样吗...太遗憾了。\n这是只有剑士大人您才能做的事情啊。

column2: Ys was the name of an ancient\nkingdom that existed here ages\nago.
column3: 『伊苏』是遥远的过去...\n曾经存在这块土地上的古王国的名字。

column2: The lost history of the land is\nwritten within the Books of Ys.
column3: 记录那被人遗忘的历史的，\n正是『伊苏之书』。

column2: It is unknown, however, who\nactually inscribed their words.
column3: 没有人知道那是出自何人之笔\n也没有人知道那是何时所写。

column2: But the six books detail the reason\nfor Ys' fall from grace.
column3: 但是据说分成六册的那本书\n记载了『伊苏』灭亡的原因。

column2: My crystal ball tells me that one\nof the Books is in the mountain\nshrine.
column3: ...水晶球显示有一本『伊苏之书』\n在山上的神殿里面。

column2: Swordsman...\nWill you search for\nthe Books of Ys?
column3: ...剑士大人。\n你愿意去寻找\n『伊苏之书』了吗？

column2: First, please visit #02Jeba#00, in\nthe village of #02Zepik.
column3: 首先你去寻找住在#02塞皮克村#00的名叫\n#02洁瓦#00的女性。

column2: She is my aunt. She knows a great\ndeal about the history of Ys. I am\ncertain she will be of aid to you.
column3: 她是我的姑母，\n对神殿与伊苏国的事很了解。\n我想她一定会帮你的忙的。

column2: Zepik Village is to the northeast,\njust outside Minea. You'll pass\nthrough it on the way to the shrine.
column3: 塞皮克村位在、\n米内亚北方草原的东北边...\n就在去山上神殿的必经道路的途中。

column2: You are not from Esteria, correct?
column3: 你不是艾斯塔里亚的人吧？

column2: Did you come here...by crossing the\nStormwall?
column3: 不会吧，你是真的越过岚之结界...\n渡海到艾斯塔里亚来的吗？

column2: Goddesses...thank you...\nI've waited so long for this day...
column3: 女神啊...感谢你...\n我等这一天不知等了多久。

column2: You are the one whom I've\nbeen seeking.
column3: 你正是...我在寻找的人。

column2: Truthfully...I must beg a\nfavor of you, swordsman.
column3: 是这样的，剑士大人，\n我想拜托你帮一件事情。

column2: How fare thee, swordsman? Have you\nfound any of the Books of Ys?
column3: 剑士大人，怎么了吗？\n找到『伊苏之书』了吗？

column2: What's that? A girl imprisoned\nbeneath the mountain shrine?!
column3: ...你说什么？\n有个少女被囚禁在神殿的地底...
莫非...
剑士大人...！\n事态紧急，到了分秒必争的时刻了。

column2: Please find the Book of Ys locked\nwithin that shrine. I'll explain\nmore afterwards.
column3: 请先找到『伊苏之书』。\n详细的事等以后再说。
剑士大人...！\n事态紧急，这是分秒必争的时候了。

column2: Please find the Book of Ys locked\nwithin that shrine. I'll explain\nmore afterwards.
column3: 请先找到『伊苏之书』。\n详细的事等以后再说。

column2: You are Adol, are you not?\n...I'm afraid I have bad news.
column3: 你就是亚特鲁吗。\n...我要告诉你一个不幸的消息。

column2: Sara was murdered...though we know\nnot who is responsible. That poor\nwoman...
column3: 莎拉被\n不明人物给杀死了。\n可怜啊...

column2: Please take this book. She\ngave it to me shortly before\nher death.
column3: 请你收下这本书。\n这是她死前托我转交的。

column2: She said to give it to a red-haired\nswordsman named Adol...and she\nsmiled as she spoke your name.
column3: ...她那时候还一边笑一边说，\n万一她有个三长两短，就麻烦我把这本书\n交给名叫亚特鲁的红发剑士。

column2: I thought she was joking. But then,\nI should've known better. She is a\nfortuneteller, after all!
column3: 那时候我以为她在开玩笑，\n忘记她的职业是占卜师。\n我应该认真看待这件事的...

column2: Ah, yes... It seems that with her\nlast dying breath, she muttered,\n#02'Adol, abandoned mine at Rastin'#00...
column3: 对了...\n莎拉断气前最后说了一句话。好像是\n『#02去废矿坑#00』。

column2: As your name was spoken, I assumed\nyou would understand the message\nshe wished to convey.
column3: 我想说不定\n你晓得她最后\n那句话的意思...
...你喜欢年纪大的女人吗？...
呵呵呵，有什么事情吗？
要做什么？
跟店老板讲话
寻找价廉物美的好东西
我想卖东西
离开商店

column2: Hmm, red hair is rare around here.\nYou're not from around these parts,\nare you?
column3: 你这头红发很罕见。\n你不是艾斯塔里亚的人吧？

column2: I'm from the mainland, myself. But I\ngot trapped on this lousy island by\nthe Stormwall.
column3: 我也是大陆来的。\n因为岚之结界的关系，\n被困在这烂地方无法离开。

column2: I think I can cut you a good deal,\nsince you're a fellow foreigner.
column3: 看在同是外地人的份上，\n我可以算你便宜一点哦。

column2: Eh? So that Sapphire Ring belongs to\nDonis? Good thing I found it, then!
column3: 哦，原来那个蓝宝石戒指\n是多尼斯的啊。\n能够找回来真是太好了。

column2: It gives me a warm feeling to know\nI can help someone out, you know?
column3: 啊，助人的感觉\n真是棒啊。

column2: You probably weren't aware, being\nan outsider and all, but this place\nhas been CRAWLING with thieves.
column3: 你是外地来的所以不知道，\n最近盗贼在米内亚闹得很厉害。

column2: And thieves are no good for business\nat all. Even before the Stormwall, I\nhad run-ins with them!
column3: 生意都被他们搅黄了，\n哪怕在结界出现之前，\n我也和他们撞上过！

column2: Gold vases and silver armor...\nExpensive stuff, you know?
column3: 被搬走的尽是金之台座啦、银之铠啦...值钱的东西。

column2: It's extremely annoying. I hope they\ncatch the bastards who took them and\nhang 'em out to dry!
column3: 想了就咬牙切齿...\n那些家伙真应该赶快抓起来，\n全部送去吊死。

column2: So, a little bird tells me you've\nbeen to the old shrine. You find\nanything good there? I pay well...
column3: 听说你去过神殿了。\n有没有得到什么宝贝？\n我可以跟你高价收购哦。

column2: I briefly toured the place before,\nbut couldn't linger on account of\nthe monsters. It was truly a pity.
column3: 我早就相准那个神殿了，问题是，\n魔物太多，连靠近都不能靠近。\n你有没有弄到什么好东西呀？

column2: Ah yes... The fortuneteller.\nMurdered, I hear.
column3: 对了，听说女占卜师被杀死了。

column2: Didn't see her own death coming...\nProbably a con artist.
column3: 她连自己的死都无法算出来，\n可见她的占卜根本就是假的。

column2: Just between the two of us, I\nalways suspected she might be in\nleague with the thieves.
column3: ...这事你可别跟外人说，\n听说啊，那女人跟盗贼是一伙的。\n说不定她是因为起内闹的关系被杀的。
